intro: Brachylaena transvaalensis, commonly known as the Transvaal brachylaena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal areas and is characterized by its distinctive yellow or orange flowers. The plant has grey-green, narrow leaves that are covered in a fine, powdery coating. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance. Brachylaena transvaalensis is also valued in traditional medicine for its various therapeutic properties.
